{{History of Vatican City}} [[File:BrecciaPortaPia.jpg|thumb|300px|The breach of [[Porta Pia]], on the right, in a contemporaneous photograph.]] The '''Roman Question''' ({{lang-it|Questione romana}}; {{lang-la|Quaestio Romana}}){{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=ABNPAQAAMAAJ&q=%22quaestio+romana%22&dq=%22quaestio+romana%22&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwi3_Zy__pnZAhVlkeAKHVETDWEQ6AEILDAA|title=Washington University Studies: New series, Language and literature|author=Brendel, Otto|date=1942|publisher=Washington University|language=en}} was a dispute regarding the temporal power of the [[pope]]s as rulers of a civil territory in the context of the Italian [[Risorgimento]]. It ended with the [[Lateran treaties|Lateran Pacts]] between King [[Victor Emmanuel III of Italy]] and [[Pope Pius XI]] in 1929. == International interest == On 9 February 1849, the [[Roman Republic (19th century)|Roman Republic]] took over the government of the [[Papal States]]. In the following July, an intervention by French troops restored [[Pope Pius IX]] to power, making the Roman Question a hotly debated one even in the internal politics of France.{{cite book|last1=Pyat|first1=Félix|title=Question romaine: affaire du 13 juin: lettre aux électeurs de la Seine, de la Nièvre et du Cher|date=1849|publisher=Société éditrice l'Union|location=Lausanne| url=https://books.google.com/books?id=mVU7AAAAcAAJ&printsec=frontcover&dq=%22question+romaine%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=eIvpVLW5LdKM7Abd8YDABg&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=%22question%20romaine%22&f=false |accessdate=22 February 2015}} In July 1859, after France and Austria made an agreement that ended the short [[Second Italian War of Independence]], an article headed "The Roman Question" in the ''[[Westminster Review]]'' expressed the opinion that the Papal States should be deprived of the Adriatic provinces and be restricted to the territory around Rome.[https://books.google.com/books?id=JgwiAQAAMAAJ&pg=RA1-PA120&dq=%22Roman+Question%22+%22Westminster+Review%22+diminution&hl=en&sa=X&ei=5sfpVI3-JvSp7Aay_oGwDQ&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=%22Roman%20Question%22%20%22Westminster%20Review%22%20diminution&f=false "The Roman Question" in ''The Westminster Review'', No. CXLI, July 1859, pp. 120–121] This became a reality in the following year, when most of the Papal States were annexed by what became the [[Kingdom of Italy]]. ==Claims of the Kingdom of Italy== {{Main article|Italian unification|Capture of Rome}} [[File:Italy unification 1815 1870.jpg|thumb|right|Italian unification process.]] On February 18, 1861, the deputies of the first [[Parliament of Italy|Italian Parliament]] assembled in [[Turin]]. On March 17, 1861, the Parliament proclaimed [[Victor Emmanuel II]] King of Italy, and on March 27, 1861, Rome was declared Capital of the Kingdom of Italy. However, the Italian Government could not take its seat in Rome because a French garrison (which had overthrown the [[Roman Republic (19th century)|Roman Republic]]), maintained there by [[Napoleon III of France]], commanded by general [[Christophe Léon Louis Juchault de Lamoricière]], was defending Pope Pius IX. Following the signing of the [[September Convention]], the seat of government was moved from Turin to Florence in 1865. The Pope remained totally opposed to the designs on Rome of [[Italian nationalism]]. Beginning in December 1869, the [[First Vatican Council]] was held in the city. Some historians have argued that its proclamation of the doctrine of [[papal infallibility]] in July 1870 had political as well as theological causes. In July 1870, the [[Franco-Prussian War]] began. In early August, [[Napoleon III]] recalled his garrison from Rome and could no longer protect what remained of the Papal States. Widespread public demonstrations demanded that the Italian government take Rome. The Italian government took no direct action until the collapse of Napoleon at the [[battle of Sedan]]. King Victor Emmanuel II then sent Count [[Gustavo Ponza di San Martino]] to Pius IX with a personal letter offering a proposal that would have allowed the peaceful entry of the Italian Army into Rome, under the guise of protecting the pope. According to Raffaele De Cesare: {{quote|The Pope's reception of San Martino [10 September 1870] was unfriendly. Pius IX allowed violent outbursts to escape him. Throwing the King's letter upon the table he exclaimed, "Fine loyalty! You are all a set of vipers, of whited sepulchres, and wanting in faith." He was perhaps alluding to other letters received from the King. After, growing calmer, he exclaimed: "I am no prophet, nor son of a prophet, but I tell you, you will never enter Rome!" San Martino was so mortified that he left the next day.De Cesare, 1909, p. 444.}} The Italian army, commanded by General [[Raffaele Cadorna]], crossed the frontier on 11 September and advanced slowly toward Rome, hoping that an unopposed entry could be negotiated. The Italian army reached the [[Aurelian Walls]] on 19 September and placed Rome under a state of siege. Pius IX decided that the surrender of the city would be granted only after his troops had put up a token resistance, enough to make it plain that the takeover was not freely accepted. On 20 September, after a cannonade of three hours had breached the Aurelian Walls at [[Porta Pia]], the [[Bersaglieri]] entered Rome (see [[capture of Rome]]). Forty-nine Italian soldiers and 19 [[Papal Zouaves]] died. Rome and the region of [[Lazio]] were annexed to the Kingdom of Italy after a plebiscite. Again, according to Raffaele De Cesare: {{quote|The Roman question was the stone tied to Napoleon's feet—that dragged him into the abyss. He never forgot, even in August 1870, a month before [[Battle of Sedan (1870)|Sedan]], that he was a sovereign of a Catholic country, that he had been made emperor, and was supported by the votes of the conservatives and the influence of the clergy; and that it was his supreme duty not to abandon the pontiff.... For twenty years Napoleon III had been the true sovereign of Rome, where he had many friends and relations.... Without him the [[temporal power (Papal)|temporal power]] would never have been reconstituted, nor, being reconstituted, would have endured."De Cesare, 1909, pp. 440–443.}} ==Dilemma== [[Pope Pius IX]] and succeeding popes [[Pope Leo XIII|Leo XIII]], [[Pope Pius X|Pius X]], [[Pope Benedict XV|Benedict XV]], and [[Pope Pius XI|Pius XI]] took great care not to recognize the legitimacy of the Italian government following the capture of Rome. Several options were considered, including giving the city a status similar to that of [[Moscow]] at the time{{citation needed|date=September 2015}} (which, despite being the capital of [[Russia]],{{citation needed|date=September 2015|reason=The Moscow article says that Moscow wasn't the capital at the time.}} was not the seat of government), but there was widespread agreement that Rome must be the capital to ensure the survival of the new state. However, [[Victor Emmanuel II of Italy]] refused to take residence in the [[Quirinal Palace]], and foreign powers were likewise uneasy with the move. The British ambassador noted the apparent contradiction of a secular government sharing the city with a religious government, while the French foreign minister wrote:
If [Italy] would consent to view Florence as the seat of government, it would solve the Papal question. It would show great sense, and the political credit it would thereby garner, as well as the honor, would offer a considerable advantage...Rome, under royal rule—an integral part of the Italian nation, but remaining Holy or, better yet, the Dominant center of the domain of the faith—would lose none of its prestige and would redound to Italy's credit. And conciliation would then come about naturally, because the pope would become accustomed to seeing himself as living in his own home, not having a king around.
However, the government refused such suggestions and the king eventually took up residence in the [[Quirinal Palace]]. Regarded by Roman citizens as the ultimate sign of authority in the city, the Quirinal had been built and used by previous popes. When asked for the keys, Pius IX reportedly said, "Whom do these thieves think they are kidding asking for the keys to open the door? Let them knock it down if they, like Bonaparte's soldiers, when they wanted to seize [[Pope Pius VI|Pius VI]], came through the window, but even they did not have the effrontery to ask for the keys". A locksmith was later hired.Kertzer 2004, pp. 79–83. ==Law of Papal Guarantees== [[Italy]]'s '''Law of Guarantees''', passed by the senate and chamber of the Italian parliament on 13 May 1871, accorded the [[Pope]] certain honors and privileges similar to those enjoyed by the [[King of Italy]], including the right to send and receive [[ambassador]]s who would have full [[diplomatic immunity]], just as if he still had [[Temporal power (Papal)|temporal power]] as ruler of a state. The law was intended to attempt to avoid further antagonizing the pope following unification and was roundly criticized by anti-clerical politicians of all alignments, but particularly on the left. At the same time, it subjected the papacy to a law that the Italian parliament could modify or abrogate at any time. [[Pope Pius IX]] and his successors refused to recognize the right of the Italian king to reign over what had formerly been the Papal States, or the right of the Italian government to decide his prerogatives and make laws for him.{{cite web|url=http://www.newadvent.org/cathen/07048a.htm|title=Law of Guarantees|work=[[Catholic Encyclopedia]] |accessdate=2007-02-18}} Asserting that the [[Holy See]] needed to maintain clearly manifested independence from any political power in its exercise of spiritual jurisdiction, and that the Pope should not appear to be merely a "chaplain of the [[King of Italy]]",Pollard, 2005, p. 11. Pius IX rejected the Law of Papal Guarantees with its offer of an annual financial payment to the Pope. Despite the Italian state's repeated assurances of the Pope's absolute liberty of movement within Italy and abroad, the popes refused to set foot outside the walls of the Vatican and thereby put themselves under the protection of the Italian forces of law and order, an implicit recognition of the changed situation. Consequently, the description "[[prisoner of the Vatican|prisoners of the Vatican]]" was applied to them,{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=y_4eaFsFdI4C&pg=PT155&dq=Kertzer+%22papal+prisoner%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=A1scUp2fBomp7Ab67IHYDQ&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=Kertzer%20%22papal%20prisoner%22&f=false|title=Prisoner of the Vatican: The Popes, the Kings, and Garibaldi's Rebels in the Struggle to Rule Modern Italy|last=Kertzer|first=David I.|date=2006-02-20|publisher=HMH|isbn=9780547347165|language=en}} until the [[Lateran Treaty]] of 1929 settled the Roman Question by establishing [[Vatican City]] as an independent state. During this time, Italian nobility who owed their titles to the Holy See rather than the Kingdom of Italy became known as the [[Black Nobility]] as they were considered to be in mourning. ==Plans to leave Rome== Several times during his pontificate, Pius IX considered leaving Rome a second time. He had fled Rome in disguise in November 1848, following the assassination of his Minister of Finance, Count [[Pellegrino Rossi]]. One occurrence was in 1862, when [[Giuseppe Garibaldi]] was in Sicily gathering volunteers for a campaign to take Rome under the slogan ''Roma o Morte'' (Rome or Death). On 26 July 1862, before Garibaldi and his volunteers were stopped at [[Battle of Aspromonte|Aspromonte]], {{quote|Pius IX confided his fears to [[Odo Russell, 1st Baron Ampthill|Lord Odo Russell]], the British Minister in Rome, and asked whether he would be granted political asylum in England after the Italian troops had marched in. Odo Russell assured him that he would be granted asylum if the need arose, but said that he was sure that the Pope's fears were unfounded.Jasper Ridley, ''Garibaldi'', Viking Press, New York (1976) p. 535}} Another instance and rumours of others occurred after the [[Capture of Rome]] and the suspension of the [[First Vatican Council]]. These were confided by [[Otto von Bismarck]] to [[Julius Hermann Moritz Busch]]: {{quote|As a matter of fact, [[Pope Pius IX|he]] has already asked whether we could grant him asylum. I have no objection to it—[[Cologne]] or [[Fulda]]. It would be passing strange, but after all not so inexplicable, and it would be very useful to us to be recognised by Catholics as what we really are, that is to say, the sole power now existing that is capable of protecting the head of their Church. [...] But the King [later to become [[Wilhelm I, German Emperor]]] will not consent. He is terribly afraid. He thinks all Prussia would be perverted and he himself would be obliged to become a Catholic. I told him, however, that if the Pope begged for asylum he could not refuse it. He would have to grant it as ruler of ten million Catholic subjects who would desire to see the head of their Church protected.Moritz Busch, ''Bismarck: Some Secret Pages of His History'', Vol. I, Macmillan (1898) p. 220, entry for 8 November 1870}} {{quote|Rumours have already been circulated on various occasions to the effect that the Pope intends to leave Rome. According to the latest of these the Council, which was adjourned in the summer, will be reopened at another place, some persons mentioning [[Malta]] and others [[Trento|Trient]]. [...] Doubtless the main object of this gathering will be to elicit from the assembled fathers a strong declaration in favour of the necessity of the [[Papal States|Temporal Power]]. Obviously a secondary object of this Parliament of Bishops, convoked away from Rome, would be to demonstrate to Europe that the Vatican does not enjoy the necessary liberty, although the Act of Guarantee proves that the Italian Government, in its desire for reconciliation and its readiness to meet the wishes of the Curia, has actually done everything that lies in its power.Moritz Busch, ''Bismarck: Some Secret Pages of His History'', Vol. II, Macmillan (1898) pp. 43–44, entry for 3 March 1872}} ==Lateran Treaty== {{Main article|Lateran Treaty}} The [[Lateran Treaty]] resolved the Roman Question in 1929; the Holy See acknowledged Italian sovereignty over the former Papal States and Italy recognized papal sovereignty over [[Vatican City]]. The Holy See limited its request for indemnity for the loss of the Papal States and of ecclesiastical property confiscated by the Italian State to much less than would have been due to it under the Law of Guarantees.{{Cite web|url=http://www.aloha.net/~mikesch/treaty.htm|title=Text of the Lateran Treaty of 1929|website=www.aloha.net|access-date=2018-08-07}} ==Literature== Historical dramas such as ''[[Fabiola (novel)|Fabiola]]'' and ''[[Quo Vadis (novel)|Quo Vadis]]'' have been interpreted as comparing the treatment of the popes by the newly formed Kingdom of Italy to the [[persecution of early Christians in the Roman Empire]].Pollard, 2005, p. 10. ==See also== *[[Legal status of the Holy See]] ==Notes== {{reflist}} ==References== * {{cite book|title=The Roman Question|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=8d1DAAAAYAAJ&printsec=frontcover&dq=About+Roman+Question&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiw_rf9xsjLAhUO6GMKHdx6A7QQ6AEIMDAA#v=onepage&q=About%20Roman%20Question&f=false|last= About|first=Edmond|year=1859|location=London|publisher=W. Jeffs}} * {{cite book|title=The Last Days of Papal Rome|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=0XcpAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA449&dq=%22the+last+days+of+papal+rome%22|last=De Cesare|first=Raffaele|year=1909|location=London|publisher=Archibald Constable & Co.}} * {{cite book|first=Peter|last=Hebblethwaite|year=1987|title=Pope John XXIII: Shepherd of the Modern World|publisher=Doubleday|location=Garden City, NY|isbn=0-385-17298-2}} *{{cite book|last=Kertzer|first=David|authorlink=David Kertzer|title=Prisoner of the Vatican|location=Boston|publisher=Houghton Mifflin Company|year=2004|isbn=0-618-22442-4}} * {{Cite book|ref=harv|last=Kertzer|first=David I.|authorlink=David Kertzer|title=The Pope and Mussolini: The Secret History of Pius XI and the Rise of Fascism in Europe|year=2014|publisher=Oxford University Press|url=https://books.google.rs/books?id=Xc3QAgAAQBAJ}} *{{cite book|first=John F.|last=Pollard |year=2005|title=Money and the Rise of the Modern Papacy: Financing the Vatican, 1850–1950|location=Cambridge|publisher=Cambridge University Press|isbn=0-521-81204-6}} *{{cite book|title=The Roman Question: Extracts from the Despatches of Odo Russell from Rome, 1858-1870|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=dZygAAAAMAAJ&q=About+Roman+Question&dq=About+Roman+Question&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjhvYSTycjLAhUKwmMKHeDKC9kQ6AEITDAF|last=Russell|first=Odo William Leopold|year=1980|location=Wilmington DE USA|publisher=M. Glazier}} (reprint of 1962 ed.) *{{cite book|title=The Roman Question and the Powers, 1848–1865|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=jcDxCAAAQBAJ&pg=PA87&dq=About+Roman+Question&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiw_rf9xsjLAhUO6GMKHdx6A7QQ6AEIQTAD#v=onepage&q=About%20Roman%20Question&f=false|last=Scott|first=Ivan|year=1969|location=Dordrecht|publisher=Springer Netherlands}} ==External links== {{Periods of papal history}} {{authority control}} [[Category:19th-century Catholicism]] [[Category:20th-century Catholicism]] [[Category:Foreign relations of the Holy See]] [[Category:History of the papacy]] [[Category:Holy See–Italy relations]] [[Category:Italian unification]] [[Category:Kingdom of Italy (1861–1946)]] [[Category:National questions]]

'''Shadow banning''' (also called '''stealth banning''', '''ghost banning''' or '''comment ghosting'''<ref name=":2" />) is the act of [[Block (Internet)|blocking]] or partially blocking a user or their content from an [[online community]] such that it will not be readily apparent to the user that they have been banned.
By making a user's contributions invisible or less prominent to other members of the service, the hope may be that in the absence of reactions to their comments, the problematic or otherwise out-of-favour user will become bored or frustrated and leave the site.<ref name=":2">{{cite news|url=http://archive.wired.com/techbiz/people/magazine/17-04/st_thompson|title=Clive Thompson on the Taming of Comment Trolls|last=Thompson|first=Clive|date=29 March 2009|accessdate=6 July 2014|newspaper=Wired magazine}}</ref><ref name="Walsh2006" />
== Notable examples == In the mid-1980s, BBS forums including [[Citadel (software)|''Citadel'' BBS software]] had a "twit bit" for problematic users.<ref name=":3">{{cite news |url=https://motherboard.vice.com/en_us/article/a3q744/where-did-shadow-banning-come-from-trump-republicans-shadowbanned |title=Where Did the Concept of 'Shadow Banning' Come From? |date=2018-07-31 |work=Motherboard |access-date=2018-08-01 |language=en-us}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{cite web |url=http://www.codinghorror.com/blog/2011/06/suspension-ban-or-hellban.html |title=Suspension, Ban or Hellban? |last=Atwood |first=Jeff |publisher=Coding Horror blog |accessdate=17 December 2011}}</ref> When enabled, the user would have limited access, and commonly still be able to read public discussions; however, any messages posted by that "twit" would not be shown to the other users of that group.<ref name=":3" /><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.citadel.org/doku.php/documentation:system_administration_manual |title=Manual installation of Citadel using source code and the command line client - Citadel.org |website=www.citadel.org |language=en |accessdate=10 March 2017}}</ref>
Michael Pryor of [[Fog Creek Software]] described stealth banning for online forums in 2006, saying how such a system was in place in the project management system [[FogBugz]], "to solve the problem of how do you get the person to go away and leave you alone". As well as preventing problem users from engaging in [[flame war]]s, the system also discouraged [[spammer]]s, who if they returned to the site would be under the false impression that their spam was still in place.<ref name="Walsh2006">{{cite book |author=Robert Walsh|title=Micro-ISV: From Vision to Reality |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=YKuYXO-LKrcC|date=12 January 2006 |publisher=Apress |isbn=978-1-4302-0114-4 |page=183 |quote=So one of the things we did in FogBugz to solve the problem of how do you get the person to go away and leave you alone is, well, you take their post and make it invisible to everyone else, but they still see it. They won’t know they’ve been deleted. There’s no one fanning their flame. You can’t get into a flame war if no one responds to your criticism. So they get silenced and eventually just go away. We have several ways of telling if they come back, and it’s been proven to be extremely, extremely effective. Say a spammer posts to your board and then they come back to check if it’s still there, and they see it—to them it’s still there—but no one else sees it, so they’re not bothered by it.}}</ref> ''[[The Verge]]'' describes it as "one of the oldest moderation tricks in the book", noting that early versions of [[vBulletin]] had a global ignore list known as "Tachy goes to Coventry",<ref name="verge">{{cite web |url=https://www.theverge.com/2017/2/16/14635030/twitter-shadow-ban-moderation |title=One of Twitter’s new anti-abuse measures is the oldest trick in the forum moderation book |last=Bohn |first=Dieter |date=2017-02-16 |website=The Verge |access-date=2017-02-17}}</ref> as in the British expression "[[Send to Coventry|to send someone to Coventry]]", meaning to ignore them and pretend they don't exist.
A 2012 update to [[Hacker News]] introduced a system of "hellbanning" for spamming and abusive behavior.<ref name="tc-evol">{{cite news |title = The Evolution of Hacker News |url = https://techcrunch.com/2013/05/18/the-evolution-of-hacker-news/ |publisher = TechCrunch |accessdate = 10 August 2014 |author = Leena Rao |date= May 18, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://pando.com/2013/12/04/can-the-democratic-power-of-a-platform-like-hacker-news-be-applied-to-products/ |title=Can the democratic power of a platform like Hacker News be applied to products? |date=2013-12-04 |work=Pando |access-date=2018-08-01 |language=en-gb}}</ref>
[[Craigslist]] has also been known to "ghost" a user's individual ads, whereby the poster gets a confirmation email and may view the ad in their account, but the ad fails to show up in the appropriate category page.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://smallbusiness.chron.com/prevent-ghost-posting-craigslist-46418.html |title=How to Prevent Ghost Posting on Craigslist |work=Small Business - Chron.com}}</ref>
Early on, [[Reddit]] implemented a similar feature, initially designed to address spam accounts, though it is also<ref>{{cite news |url=https://citizenlab.org/2016/11/wechat-china-censorship-one-app-two-systems/|title=One App, Two Systems: How WeChat uses one censorship policy in China and another internationally - The Citizen Lab |date=2016-11-30 |work=The Citizen Lab |access-date=2017-04-29 |language=en-US}}</ref> used for general users.<ref>{{cite web |author1=krispykrackers |title=On shadowbans. • r/self|url=https://www.reddit.com/r/self/comments/3ey0fv/on_shadowbans/ |website=[[Reddit]] |language=en}}</ref> In 2015, Reddit added an account suspension feature,<ref>{{cite web |last1=Shu |first1=Catherine |title=Reddit Replaces Its Confusing Shadowban System With Account Suspensions |url=https://techcrunch.com/2015/11/11/reddit-account-suspensions/ |website=TechCrunch |accessdate=16 September 2017 |language=en}}</ref> though the site still makes extensive use of shadow banning.{{citation needed|date=August 2018}}
[[WeChat]] was found in 2016 to ban posts and messages that contain certain keywords without notice.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://boingboing.net/2016/12/02/chinas-we-chat-shadow-bans.html |title=China's We Chat "shadow-bans" messages with forbidden keywords, but only for China-based accounts |website=Boing Boing |access-date=2017-04-29}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://citizenlab.ca/2016/11/wechat-china-censorship-one-app-two-systems/ |title=One App, Two Systems: How WeChat uses one censorship policy in China and another internationally - The Citizen Lab |date=2016-11-30 |work=The Citizen Lab |access-date=2018-08-01 |language=en-US}}</ref>
In a study that looked at tweets from 2014 to early 2015, over a quarter million tweets were found during the one year period in Turkey to have been censored via shadow banning.<ref>{{cite journal |last=Tanash |first=Rima S. |last2=Chen |first2=Zhouhan |last3=Thakur |first3=Tanmay |last4=Wallach |first4=Dan S. |last5=Subramanian |first5=Devika |date=2015-01-01 |title=Known Unknowns: An Analysis of Twitter Censorship in Turkey|url=http://doi.acm.org/10.1145/2808138.2808147|journal=Proceedings of the 14th ACM Workshop on Privacy in the Electronic Society|series=WPES '15|location=New York, NY, USA |publisher=ACM |pages=11–20 |doi=10.1145/2808138.2808147 |isbn=9781450338202}}</ref> [[Twitter]] was also found, in 2015, to shadowban tweets containing leaked documents in the US.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-intersect/wp/2015/10/30/a-guide-to-why-some-activists-believe-their-tweets-are-being-censored-in-the-u-s/|title=Tweets are disappearing on Twitter. Why? |last=Ohlheiser |first=Abby |date=2015-10-30 |work=The Washington Post |access-date=2017-04-29 |last2=Ohlheiser|first2=Abby|language=en-US |issn=0190-8286}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://motherboard.vice.com/en_us/article/539nvn/is-twitter-censoring-a-blockbuster-report-on-us-drone-assassinations |title=Is Twitter Censoring a Blockbuster Report on US Drone Assassinations? |website=Motherboard |language=en-us |access-date=2017-07-26}}</ref>
The phenomenon was noticed on [[Instagram]] in 2017; there, certain posts have been seen to be unavailable to people who do not follow one in hashtag searches.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://mic.com/articles/178987/instagrams-shadowban-explained-how-to-tell-if-instagram-is-secretly-blacklisting-your-posts |title=Instagram’s “shadowban,” explained: How to tell if Instagram is secretly blacklisting your posts |last=Lorenz |first=Taylor |date=June 7, 2017 |work=[[Mic Network Inc.]] |access-date=2017-11-04 |archive-url= |archive-date= |dead-url= |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://lifehacker.com/how-to-see-if-your-instagram-posts-have-been-shadowbann-1794547574 |title=How to See If Your Instagram Posts Have Been Shadowbanned |last=Wong |first=Kristin |work=Lifehacker |access-date=2017-11-04 |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://petapixel.com/2017/03/28/photographers-claim-instagram-shadow-banning-accounts/ |title=Photographers Claim Instagram is 'Shadow Banning' Their Accounts |date=2017-03-28 |website=PetaPixel |access-date=2017-04-26}}</ref>
"Shadow banning" became popularized in 2018 as a conspiracy theory that Twitter had shadow-banned Republicans.<ref>{{cite web|last=Romano|first=Aja|url=https://www.vox.com/2018/9/6/17824652/twitter-dorsey-energy-and-commerce-hearing-shadow-banning|title=How hysteria over Twitter shadow-banning led to a bizarre congressional hearing|publisher=Vox.com|date=6 September 2018}}</ref> In late July 2018, ''[[Vice News]]'' found that several supporters of the [[US Republican Party]] no longer appeared in the auto-populated drop-down search menu on Twitter, thus limiting their visibility when being searched for - allegedly due to the same algorithm that was being used to do the same to the accounts of prominent racists. <ref name=Vice2018>{{cite news |last=Thompson |first=Alex |date=26 July 2018 |title=Twitter appears to have fixed “shadow ban” of prominent Republicans like the RNC chair and Trump Jr.’s spokesman |url=https://news.vice.com/en_us/article/43paqq/twitter-is-shadow-banning-prominent-republicans-like-the-rnc-chair-and-trump-jrs-spokesman |work=Vice News |location= |access-date=15 August 2018 }}</ref> After that finding, some conservatives accused Twitter of enacting a shadowban on Republican accounts, which Twitter flatly denied.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/07/26/us/politics/twitter-shadowbanning.html |title=What Is a ‘Shadow Ban,’ and Is Twitter Doing It to Republican Accounts? |date=July 26, 2018 |language=en}}</ref><ref name=":0">{{cite news |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/fruzsinaeordogh/2018/07/31/why-republicans-werent-the-only-ones-shadow-banned-on-twitter/#4b19426e434b |title=Why Republicans Weren't The Only Ones Shadow Banned On Twitter |date=July 31, 2018 |language=en}}</ref> However, some accounts that were not overtly political or conservative apparently had the same algorithm applied to them. <ref name=":0" /> In a blog post, Twitter said that the use of the phrase "shadow banning" was inaccurate, as the tweets were still visible by navigating to the home page of the relevant account.<ref>{{cite web |title=Setting the record straight on shadow banning |url=https://blog.twitter.com/official/en_us/topics/company/2018/Setting-the-record-straight-on-shadow-banning.html |website=Twitter |accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref> Later, Twitter restored the affected accounts.<ref name=Vice2018 />

kid|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/923639/cops-kill-pistol-packing-grade-11-kid|accessdate=August 19, 2017|newspaper=Philippine Daily Inquirer |date=August 18, 2017}} His mother, Lorenza, worked as a domestic helper in [[Riyadh]], [[Saudi Arabia]], while his father, Saldy,{{refn|Spelled "Zaldy" in some sources.|group=n}} operated a [[sari-sari store]] which was manned by Kian from 5:30 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. every day before he went to school. After closing the store at night, he would usually walk around the block for some small talk with neighborhood friends. At the time of his death, he was a Grade 11 (senior high school) student at Our Lady of Lourdes College in [[Valenzuela, Metro Manila|Valenzuela]]. His high school principal stated that Delos Santos was never summoned to his office for any delinquency or misconduct. According to a classmate and close friend of his, Delos Santos wanted to become a cadet of the [[Philippine National Police Academy]].{{cite news|last1=Bajo|first1=Anna Felicia|title=Kian's girlfriend, classmates, teachers in grief, outrage over his death|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/metro/622457/kian-s-girlfriend-classmates-teachers-in-grief-outrage-over-his-death/story/|accessdate=August 19, 2017|publisher=[[GMA News]] |date=August 19, 2017}} Delos Santos was also in favor of the government's war on drugs, according to another classmate. Both [[Police rank#Philippines|Senior Superintendent]] Chito Bersaluna, the Police Chief of Caloocan, and [[Police rank#Philippines|Chief Inspector]] Amor Cerillo, the commander of the local Police Community Precinct, have separately admitted that Delos Santos was not on their police watch list. However, they believed that he was a [[Mule (smuggling)|drug runner]] "based on a statement of another arrested drug suspect". The officials of Barangay 160, Caloocan also confirmed that Delos Santos was not on their drugs watch list.{{cite news|last1=Santos|first1=Jel|title=Family of Kian delos Santos blast Caloocan police for shifting blame on them|url=http://news.mb.com.ph/2017/08/19/family-of-kian-delos-santos-blast-caloocan-police-for-shifting-blame-on-them/|accessdate=August 19, 2017|newspaper=Manila Bulletin|date=August 19, 2017}} On August 26, 2017, a [[Requiem|Catholic funeral Mass]] for Delos Santos was held at 8 a.m., at a parish in Sta. Quiteria, Caloocan; it was attended by his family and friends, and hundreds of other people, including human rights advocates. At around 2 p.m., Delos Santos was interred at [[La Loma Cemetery]].{{refn|{{cite news|title=Hundreds of supporters call for justice as Kian is laid to rest|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2017/08/26/Kian-delos-santos-burial.html|accessdate=August 26, 2017|work=[[CNN Philippines]]|date=August 26, 2017}}{{cite news|title=Enormous crowd attends funeral of Kian|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2017/08/26/1732926/enormous-crowd-attends-funeral-kian|accessdate=August 26, 2017|work=[[The Philippine Star]]|date=August 26, 2017}}{{cite news|title=Hundreds march as Kian laid to rest|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/623419/hundreds-march-as-kian-laid-to-rest/story/|accessdate=August 26, 2017|work=[[GMA News and Public Affairs]]|date=August 26, 2017}}}} ==Incident== [[File:02340jfBarangays Baesa Landmarks Roads Caloocan Cityfvf 06.jpg|thumb|Barangay 160, Caloocan (in 2016), where the victim lived]] At around 8:00 p.m [[Philippine Standard Time|PST]] on August 16, 2017, officers of the [[Philippine National Police]] (PNP) led by [[Police rank#Philippines|PO3]] Arnel Oares, were conducting a "one-time, big-time" anti-illegal drugs operation in Barangay 160, Caloocan where Delos Santos lived. During the anti-drug operation, Delos Santos went missing for almost an hour, which prompted his family to look for him at the nearest police station but failed to find him there. Several gunshots were then heard.{{cite news|title=Grade 11 student killed during anti-drug op in Caloocan|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/metro/622230/grade-11-student-killed-during-anti-drug-op-in-caloocan/story/|accessdate=August 19, 2017|publisher=GMA News |date=August 17, 2017}} At 8:57 p.m., C/Insp. Amor Cerillo and another police officer, both in plainclothes, arrived at the [[Barangay hall|hall]] of Barangay 160 to report a supposed shootout. In a muddy and dark alley near his house, which was the site of the alleged encounter, Delos Santos was found in fetal position with gunshot wounds to his head. Recovered from his corpse were a [[.45 caliber ammunition|.45-caliber]] pistol, four [[Cartridge (firearms)|cartridges]], and two sachets of suspected [[methamphetamine]]. ===Police report=== According to the official police report, at around 8:45 p.m, Delos Santos tried to flee when he noticed the police officers approaching him. He then drew his gun and "directly shot" towards the police, which prompted PO3 Arnel Oares to fire back in self-defense, killing Delos Santos. The pistol, cartridges, and two sachets of methamphetamine were then found in Delos Santos's possession.{{cite news|last1=Galupo|first1=Rey|last2=Tupas|first2=Emmanuel|last3=Ong|first3=Ghio|title=Boy, 17, killed in Caloocan drug operation|url=http://www.philstar.com:8080/metro/2017/08/18/1730174/boy-17-killed-caloocan-drug-operation|accessdate=August 19, 2017|newspaper=The Philippine Star |date=August 18, 2017}}{{cite news|last1=Almelor|first1=Dominic|title=Binatilyo, patay nang 'manlaban' sa pulis; pero iba ang kuha sa CCTV|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/video/news/08/17/17/binatilyo-patay-nang-manlaban-sa-pulis-pero-iba-ang-kuha-sa-cctv|accessdate=August 19, 2017|publisher=[[ABS-CBN News]] |date=August 17, 2017|language=Filipino}} According to Cerillo and Bersaluna, a drug dealer that they earlier arrested claimed that Delos Santos was the [[Mule (smuggling)|mule]] of "Neneng" Escopino, a local drug dealer on the police watch list.{{cite news|last1=Popioco|first1=Makoi|title=Fourth witness comes forward in Kian Loyd Delos Santos case|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2017/08/19/fourth-witness-kian-loyd-delos-santos.html|accessdate=August 19, 2017|publisher= CNN Philippines |date=August 19, 2017}} ===Witness accounts and CCTV footage=== Witnesses claim that Delos Santos was just loitering near his house at around 8:00 p.m., when two unidentified men grabbed him and led him away. The barangay's [[CCTV]] footage of the incident shows that at 8:24 p.m., a young man believed to be Delos Santos was being dragged by two men in plainclothes towards the area where his corpse would be later found. The video also showed a third man that headed towards the same direction. Cerillo confirmed that the two men in the video were plainclothes police officers. He also clarified that the person being dragged was not Delos Santos, but rather a police [[Asset (intelligence)|asset]]. Bersaluna and Cirillo also clarified that police officers are not required to wear their uniforms during anti-illegal drugs operations. Two witnesses who approached Dominic Almelor of [[ABS-CBN News]] claimed that Delos Santos was blindfolded by the two men and forced to hold a gun, fire it, and run. Another witness who approached Saleema Refran of [[GMA News]] claimed that Delos Santos begged for his life before getting shot. Afterwards, the shooters approached the witness and asked him if he knew the victim, which he denied. The witness later confirmed that the men who were filmed inside the barangay hall reporting the alleged shootout were the same men who shot Delos Santos.{{cite news|last1=Bajo|first1=Anna Felicia|title=Witness: Kian Delos Santos begged for his life before being killed by cops|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/metro/622446/witness-kian-delos-santos-begged-for-his-life-before-being-killed-by-cops/story/|accessdate=August 19, 2017|publisher=GMA News |date=August 18, 2017}} A 13-year-old witness interviewed by ''[[The Manila Bulletin]]'' claimed that she saw Delos Santos being punched and slapped by four armed plainclothes officers before he was dragged away.{{cite news|last1=Santos|first1=Jel|title='Tama na po. May test pa ako bukas'|url=http://news.mb.com.ph/2017/08/19/tama-na-po-may-test-pa-ako-bukas/|accessdate=August 19, 2017|newspaper=[[The Manila Bulletin]] |date=August 19, 2017}} Delos Santos's uncle, Randy, questioned the police claim that the victim had a concealed firearm, since his nephew was wearing [[Boxer shorts|boxers]] at that time. Delos Santos's father, Saldy, also pointed out that the pistol was recovered from the left hand of his otherwise right-handed son. ==Reactions== ===Public response and protests=== Many Filipino [[netizens]] expressed outrage over Delos Santos's death. Both the hashtag #JusticeforKian and the phrase "Kian delos Santos" were among the top Philippine trends on [[Twitter]] on August 18.{{cite news|title='Nakakadurog ng puso': #JusticeforKian trends nationwide on Twitter|url=http://www.rappler.com/technology/social-media/179177-justice-for-kian-trends|accessdate=August 19, 2017|publisher=Rappler |date=August 18, 2017}} A rally titled ''Himagsikan para kay Kian'' ("Revolution for Kian") took place on August 21 ([[Ninoy Aquino Day]]) at the [[People Power Monument]] in [[Quezon City]].{{cite news|title='Himagsikan para kay Kian' set on August 21|url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/179307-rally-kian-delos-santos-people-power-monument|accessdate=August 19, 2017|publisher=Rappler |date=August 19, 2017}}{{cite news|last1=Molina|first1=Carlo Canadian Inquirer''|date=August 21, 2017}} Among the groups present were [[Akbayan]], Alliance of Progressive Labor, Alyansa Tigil Mina, Sentro, [[Partido ng Manggagawa]], Kalipunan ng Kilusang Masa, Block [[Ferdinand Marcos|Marcos]], Silent Minorities, and Kalipun.{{cite news|last1=Cabrera|first1=Romina|last2=Alquitran|first2=Non|title=Rain fails to dampen rally for Kian|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2017/08/22/1731577/rain-fails-dampen-rally-kian|accessdate=25 August 2017|publisher=''The Philippine Star''|date=August 22, 2017}} Senator [[Bam Aquino]], former [[Bayan Muna]] Representative [[Teodoro Casiño|Teddy Casiño]], and former Education Secretary [[Armin Luistro]] were also present.{{cite news|title=Hundreds protest Kian's killing under rain|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/622731/hundreds-protest-kian-s-killing-under-rain/story/|accessdate=25 August 2017|agency=''GMA News''|date=August 21, 2017}} A moment of silence was held at 8:24 p.m., the same time Delos Santos was allegedly filmed being dragged by police officers on August 16. The protesters—numbering from 500 to 1,000—also called for the investigation of other drug war killings.{{cite news|title=Protesters call for justice despite heavy rain|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2017/08/21/Protesters-call-for-justice-Kian-delos-Santos.html|accessdate=25 August 2017|agency=''CNN Philippines''|date=August 21, 2017}} Earlier that same day, the [[Liberal Party (Philippines)|Liberal Party Youth]], with the support of other groups, also held a rally at [[Plaza Miranda]] in [[Manila]], denouncing Delos Santos's killing. The rally also commemorated the 1971 [[Plaza Miranda bombing]] and the 1983 [[Assassination of Benigno Aquino Jr.|Assassination of Senator Ninoy Aquino]].{{cite news|title=Three protests denouncing Kian Delos Santos's death happening today|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2017/08/21/Kian-Loyd-Delos-Santos-death-rally-August-21.html|accessdate=25 August 2017|agency=''CNN Philippines''|date=August 21, 2017}}{{cite news|title=Palace respects rally for student slain in drug war, says it's people's right to assemble, express views|url=http://www.manilatimes.net/palace-respects-rally-student-slain-drug-war-says-peoples-right-assemble-express-views/345839/|accessdate=25 August 2017|publisher=''[[The Manila Times]]''|date=August 21, 2017}}{{cite news|title=Duterte sa mga pulis sa Kian case: Ikulong kung may sala|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/news/08/21/17/duterte-sa-mga-pulis-sa-kian-case-ikulong-kung-may-sala|accessdate=25 August 2017|agency=''ABS-CBN News''|date=August 22, 2017|language=Filipino}} ===Public figures=== During a press briefing on August 18, [[Presidential Communications Group (Philippines)#Presidential Spokesperson|Presidential Spokesperson]] [[Ernesto Abella]] called the shooting of Delos Santos an "isolated" incident, and added "[President Duterte] will defend the police in their carrying out of duties. However, he will also not tolerate any abuse and any breaches of the law".{{cite news|last1=Corrales|first1=Nestor|title=Killing of teenager in Caloocan anti-drug ops 'isolated,' says Palace|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/923776/killing-of-teenager-in-caloocan-anti-drug-ops-isolated-says-palace|accessdate=21 August 2017|publisher=''Philippine Daily Inquirer''|date=August 18, 2017}}{{cite news|last1=Morallo|first1=Audrey|title=Palace describes death of boy, 17, as 'isolated'|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2017/08/18/1730400/palace-describes-death-boy-17-isolated|accessdate=21 August 2017|publisher=''The Philippine Star''|date=August 18, 2017}}{{cite news|title=Duterte won't tolerate police abuse, Palace assures public|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/622381/duterte-won-t-tolerate-police-abuse-palace-assures-public/story/|accessdate=21 August 2017|agency=''GMA News''|date=August 18, 2017}} On August 19, in an interview with [[DZRB-AM|Radyo Pilipinas]], Assistant to the Presidential Spokesperson [[China Jocson]] stated: "Presidential Spokesperson Ernesto Abella would like to make it clear that the violent death of any Filipino is one death too many, especially that of Kian Loyd delos Santos. This deeply regrettable incident has triggered deep public sentiment, and challenges those in law enforcement to be wary of the reckless exercise of power and authority."{{cite news|last1=Ballaran|first1=Jhoanna|title=Palace on killing of teen in drug raid: 'One death too many'|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/924006/kian-loyd-delos-santos-war-on-drugs-ejks-ernesto-abella-rodrigo-duterte|accessdate=21 August 2017|publisher=''Philippine Daily Inquirer''|date=August 19, 2017}}{{cite news|last1=Cepeda|first1=Mara|title=Malacañang: Police should be 'wary of reckless exercise of power'|url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/179271-malacanang-police-wary-reckless-exercise-power|accessdate=21 August 2017|publisher=''Rappler''|date=August 20, 2017}} Also on the same day, the [[Department of Education (Philippines)|Department of Education]] released a statement saying it "strongly condemns" the killing of grade 11 student Kian Delos Santos and that while it acknowledged "efforts to battle illegal drugs," it maintained that "upholding the rule of law should not be compromised." The agency also said that it "denounces all forms of violence against our students, teachers, and personnel."{{Cite news|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/news/08/20/17/deped-condemns-kians-killing-backs-impartial-probe|title=DepEd condemns Kian's killing, backs impartial probe|last=News|first=ABS-CBN|work=ABS-CBN News|access-date=2017-08-22|language=en-US}} Also on August 19, during an emergency peace and order council meeting, [[Mayor of Caloocan|Caloocan Mayor]] [[Oscar Malapitan]] said "It seems hard to believe that a 17-year-old would shoot it out with three police officers" and added: "even if Kian were indeed a drug pusher, he shouldn't have been killed unless the cops were only defending themselves. The public perception is that the cops killed Kian when he was obviously helpless."{{cite news|last1=Subingsubing|first1=Krixia|title=Mayor, bishop grill cops over Kian killing|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/924090/war-on-drugs-kian-loyd-delos-santos-caloocan-city-police-station-oscar-malapitan-pablo-david-chito-bersaluna-extrajudicial-killings|accessdate=29 September 2017|publisher=''Philippine Daily Inquirer''|date=August 20, 2017}} Senator [[JV Ejercito]], through a series of tweets, described the incident as "very very disturbing" pointing out that Delos Santos was the same age as his eldest son.{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/jvejercito/status/898425147844997120|title=The killing of 17 year-old Kian Lloyd Delos Santos in the latest on war against drugs is very very disturbing.|last=Ejercito|first=J. He also claimed that visiting the wake would make him pretentious like the politicians. ===President Rodrigo Duterte=== When President Rodrigo Duterte saw the CCTV tape, he immediately called PNP Chief Ronald Bato Dela Rosa, and said "hulihin mo na at kulungin mo [ang mga pulis na dawit sa pagkasawi ni Kian]" (bring those policemen who are involved in Kian's killing to jail). The president also warned some police officers, for they are abusing their powers to do so.{{Cite news|title=Duterte sa mga pulis sa Kian case: ikulong kung may sala|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/news/08/21/17/duterte-sa-mga-pulis-sa-kian-case-ikulong-kung-may-sala|language=Tagalog|agency=ABS-CBN News|date=August 21, 2017}} ==Investigation== The four police officers, who were tagged in the shooting of Delos Santos, were relieved from their posts.{{cite news|title=4 cops in Caloocan teen's death relieved, placed under 'restrictive Santos sustained three gunshot wounds: the first entry point was at the back of the head, the second entry point was behind the left ear and the third entry point was inside the left ear.{{cite news|title=Autopsy shows Kian died of 3 gunshot wounds to the head|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/924361/breaking-kian-delos-santos-autopsy-report-gunshot-wound-killing-drug-war-head|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]}} The family of Delos Santos, on August 25, filed murder and torture charges against police officers involved in the drug operation.{{cite news|title=Murder, torture raps filed vs. police over Kian's death|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2017/08/25/Kians-kin-files-murder-torture-raps-vs.-Caloocan-police.html|work=[[CNN Philippines]]}} ==Justice== Three Caloocan City policemen Police Officer 3 Arnel Oares, PO1 Jeremiah Pereda and Jerwin Cruz were found guilty of killing Kian Lloyd delos Santos during an anti-narcotics and were sentenced to life in prison for murdering a teenager during a drug sting in 2017 by Caloocan Regional Trial Court Branch 125 Judge Rodolfo Azucena sentenced the three policemen to life in prison without the possibility of parole on November 29, 2018.{{citenews|title=3 cops guilty kian santos murder|url=https://www.philstar.com/headlines/2018/11/30/1872988/3-cops-guilty-kian-delos-santos-murder-|work=[[Philippines Star]]}} ==Similar incidents== {{expand section|date=September 2017}} The case of Kian delos Santos has been likened to the cases of other teenagers, 19-year-old Carl Arnaiz and 14-year-old Reynaldo "Kulot" De Guzman. Arnaiz went missing for ten days; his dead body found on August 28 in a morgue in [[Caloocan]].{{Cite news|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/928639/carl-angelo-arnaiz-police-autopsy-crime-laboratory-bullet-wounds-northern-police-district-reynaldo-de-guzman|title=Carl Arnaiz sustained 5 bullet wounds in the body–NPD Crime Lab|last=Ballaran|first=Jhoanna|access-date=2017-09-21|language=en}} According to the Caloocan police Arnaiz was involved in a robbery at [[C-3 road]]. The police said that he declared a robbery to the driver of the vehicle he allegedly hit, and drew a gun. The driver reportedly sought help from the police and Arnaiz successfully shot PO1 Jefrey Perez and PO1 Ricky Arquta who in turn fired in retaliation causing the teenager's death. The police claimed in an August 30 report that they retrieved two packs of marijuana in his pocket and three packs of a substance suspected to be [[methamphetamine]] in his backpack.{{cite news|last1=Viray|first1=Patricia Lourdes|title=What we know so far: Killing of Carl Arnaiz, 19|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2017/09/04/1735729/what-we-know-so-far-killing-carl-arnaiz|accessdate=12 September 2017|work=The Philippine Star|date=4 September 2017}} A [[Cainta]], [[Rizal]] resident, Arnaiz left his house with de Guzman to eat midnight snacks on August 17 according to his parents. Arnaiz's father says that his son's only vice is smoking and denied he possessed said contraband. De Guzman's alleged body was found floating in Kinamatayang Kabayo creek in the town of [[Gapan]], [[Nueva Ecija]]. De Guzman's father theorized that his son may have been killed so he could not testify against the killers of Arnaiz.{{cite news|title=Carl Angelo Arnaiz's companion found dead in Nueva Ecija|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/624762/carl-angelo-arnaiz-s-companion-found-dead-in-nueva-ecija/story/|accessdate=12 September 2017|work=GMA News|date=6 September 2017}} The [[Philippine National Police]] conducted a DNA test on the corpse and said that the body is not De Guzman's. However, his parents dispute the findings saying that they are certain that the body is that of their son.{{cite news|last1=Gotinga|first1=JC|title=PNP: Body found in Nueva Ecija creek not Reynaldo de Guzman|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/sports/2017/09/11/Reynaldo-De-Guzman-DNA-test-Carl-Arnaiz.html|accessdate=12 September 2017|work=CNN Philippines|date=12 September 2017}} ==Notes and References== '''Notes''' {{Reflist|group=n}} '''References''' {{reflist}} {{Philippine Drug War events}} {{DEFAULTSORT:delos Reyes, Kian Loyd}} [[Category:Philippine Drug War]] [[Category:Law enforcement in the Philippines]] [[Category:August 2017 events in the Philippines]] [[Category:Drugs in the Philippines]] [[Category:2017 crimes in the Philippines]] [[Category:Protests in the Philippines]] [[Category:2017 protests]] [[Category:2017 controversies]]

{{Infobox company | name = Sound Diplomacy | logo = | type = Private | foundation = 2013 | location_city = [[London]], [[Berlin]], [[Barcelona]] | location_country = [[United Kingdom]], [[Germany]], [[Spain]] | key_people = | industry = Consulting | services = Music strategy | num_employees = | parent = | subsid = | homepage = [http://www.sounddiplomacy.com// www.sounddiplomacy.com] | footnotes = | intl = }}
'''Sound Diplomacy''' is a [[London]], [[Barcelona]] and [[Berlin]]-based music agency.<ref>''[http://www.recordoftheday.com/news-and-press/the-great-escape-co-founder-launches-boutique-showcase-in-catalunya-spain “The Great Escape co-founder launches boutique showcase in Catalunya, Spain”]'', Record Of The Day</ref>
== History ==
Sound Diplomacy was founded in May 2013 by Shapiro, UK representative for the Canadian Independent Music Association (CIMA, formerly [[CIRPA]]),<ref>''[http://www.thecanadianencyclopedia.com/en/article/cima-emc/ "CIMA (Canadian Independent Music Association)"]'', The Canadian Encyclopedia</ref> and the former UK head of [[:ca:Catalan! Arts|Catalan! Arts]] Jordi Puy.<ref name="completemusicupdate">''[http://www.completemusicupdate.com/article/new-music-export-consultancy-sound-diplomacy-launches/ “New music export consultancy Sound Diplomacy launches”]'', Complete Music Update</ref> Katja Hermes became the director of the company’s German office in November 2013.<ref>''[http://cmw.net/conferences/music-summit/3-day-music-summit/ 3 Day Music Summit - Panel Schedule]'', Canadian Music Week</ref><ref>''[http://www.mediabiz.de/musik/news/katja-hermes-steigt-bei-sound-diplomacy-ein/340613 “Katja Hermes steigt bei Sound Diplomacy ein”]'' (in German), MusikWoche</ref> Sound Diplomacy launched with clients including CIMA, [[HootSuite]], ICEC and Osheaga MEG Pro.<ref name="completemusicupdate" /> In October 2013, Sound Diplomacy partnered with Martin Elbourne and Spanish promoter Xavi Manresa to launch a new boutique showcase in [[Catalonia]], '[[Lleida]] Sessions Pro'.<ref>''[http://www.musicweek.com/news/read/the-great-escape-s-elbourne-launches-new-spanish-showcase/056275 "The Great Escape's Elbourne launches new Spanish showcase”]'', Music Week</ref>
Also in October 2013, Sound Diplomacy reached an agreement to represent the Spanish music conference '[[Bizkaia]] International Music Experience (BIME)' in countries such as [[UK]], [[Canada]], [[Australia]], [[South Africa]], [[Colombia]] and [[Uruguay]].<ref>''[http://bime.net/en/bime-sound-diplomacy-reach-ambitious-agreement/ "BIME And Sound Diplomacy Reach An Ambitious Agreement”] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140203042527/http://bime.net/en/bime-sound-diplomacy-reach-ambitious-agreement/ |date=2014-02-03 }}'', [[Bizkaia]] International Music Experience</ref><ref>''[http://www.ltinews.net/LTI/bime/2077-bime-alcanza-un-ambicioso-acuerdo-con-sound-diplomacy-para-llegar-a-reino-unido-canada-australia-sudafrica-colombia-y-uruguay-entre-otros "Bime Alcanza Un Ambicioso Acuerdo Con Sound Diplomacy..."]'' (in Spanish), LTInews</ref> In November 2013, Sound Diplomacy established a partnership with Nouvelle Prague, a showcase festival that takes place in [[Prague]], [[Czech Republic]].<ref>''[http://www.expats.cz/prague/article/czech-culture/the-whole-wide-worlds-got-talent/ "The Whole Wide World's Got Talent"]'', Expats.cz</ref><ref>''[http://www.ifpi.cz/showcase-festival-nouvelle-prague/ "Showcase Festival Nouvelle Prague"]'' (in Czech), The International Federation of the Phonographic Industry (IFPI), Czech Republic</ref><ref>''[http://nouvelleprague.com/contacts/ "Contacts"]'', Nouvelle Prague</ref> In April 2014 Sound Diplomacy hired artist manager Danny Keir, who previously had worked at Black Book Management with artists such as [[Razorlight]], [[Noisettes]], Glitches and [[Lucy Rose]]. <ref>''[http://www.musicweek.com/news/read/danny-keir-joins-sound-diplomacy/058187 "Danny Keir joins Sound Diplomacy”]'', Music Week</ref><ref>''[http://www.recordoftheday.com/news-and-press/sound-diplomacy-hires-danny-keir-and-expands-its-client-base “Sound Diplomacy hires Danny Keir and expands its client base”]'', Record Of The Day</ref><ref>''[http://www.digitalmusicnews.com/permalink/2014/04/15/execshuffles-8 “Executive Shuffles: Columbia, Syco, Republic, Sound Diplomacy, Words & Music”]'', Digital Music News</ref>
In addition, Sound Diplomacy started working on [[Mixcloud]]'s #Curates conference, the online distribution service [[Music Kickup]], South African festival Parklife, in-flight content for [[Iberia]] with content marketing agency [[Spafax]], on the first music business event in Costa Rica called Epicentro, [[:de: Initiative Musik|Initiative Musik]] Germany, the [[Adam Mickiewicz Institute]] in Poland and [[Berklee College of Music]] and their online degree program.<ref>''[http://www.musicweek.com/news/read/danny-keir-joins-sound-diplomacy/058187 "Danny Keir joins Sound Diplomacy”]'', Music Week</ref><ref>''[http://www.recordoftheday.com/news-and-press/sound-diplomacy-hires-danny-keir-and-expands-its-client-base “Sound Diplomacy hires Danny Keir and expands its client base”]'', Record Of The Day</ref>
In 2018 they delivered the first ever music focused panel at the United Nations World Urban Forum, outlining how music is a highly effective tool in delivering the UN's Strategic Development Goals.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://wuf9.org/programme/speakers/shain-shapiro/|title=WUF 9 - The Ninth session of the World Urban Forum|website=WUF 9 – The Ninth session of the World Urban Forum|language=en-US|access-date=2018-10-30}}</ref> In November 2018 a white paper co-written by Sound Diplomacy and Pro Colombia (commissioned by the United Nations World Travel Organisation) was launched at the World Travel Market in London. The white paper outlines how destinations around the world could use music tourism strategies to drive profile, visitors and associated revenues.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://london.wtm.com/en/Sessions/67425/Launching-a-white-paper-on-music-and-tourism-Music-is-the-new-gastronomy|title=Launching a white paper on music and tourism: Music is the new gastronomy - Conferences - WTM London|date=2018-10-26|website=london.wtm.com|language=en|access-date=2018-10-30}}</ref>
In October 2018 Sound Diplomacy, in association with Found in Music, initiated an inquiry at the House of Lords examining the full value of music in society. The 5 evidence meetings (between October 2018 and March 2019) Chaired by Lord Tim Clement-Jones investigate the role of music in a number of government related topics including future-proof skills learning (for a future AI led workplace), public health, the ageing population and economic development.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.musicinsociety.uk|title=musicinsociety|website=www.musicinsociety.uk|access-date=2018-10-30}}</ref>
== Nominations ==
In November 2013, Shain Shapiro was nominated as a finalist for [[The Hospital Club]]'s #100 list in the [[British Council]]'s Creative Entrepreneurs Category for his work at Sound Diplomacy.<ref>''[http://www.thehospitalclub.com/100/nominees.php?c=21 "Creative Entrepreneurs sponsored by the British Council”] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131220040711/http://www.thehospitalclub.com/100/nominees.php?c=21 |date=2013-12-20 }}'', The Hospital Club</ref><ref>''[https://www.theguardian.com/culture-professionals-network/culture-professionals-blog/2013/nov/19/hospital-club-100-list-2013#Music "The Hospital Club 100 list 2013”]'', The Guardian</ref>
Sound Diplomacy were shortlisted for Best Hackney Business at The Mayor of Hackney's Business Awards 2015. <ref>http://www.hackney.gov.uk/business-awards</ref> == References ==

{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2015}} {{Infobox magazine | title = Sábado | logo = | logo_size = <!-- default is 180px --> | image_file = <!-- cover.jpg (omit the "file:" prefix) --> | image_size = <!-- default is 180px --> | image_alt = | image_caption = | editor = <!-- up to |editor5= --> | editor_title = <!-- up to |editor_title5= --> | previous_editor = | staff_writer = | photographer = | category = | frequency = Weekly | format = | circulation = 57,261 (September-October 2013) | publisher = [[Cofina]] | paid_circulation = | unpaid_circulation = | circulation_year = | total_circulation = | founder = | founded = {{start date and age|1988}} | firstdate = <!-- {{Start date|year|month|day}} --> | finaldate = | finalnumber = | company = | country = [[Portugal]] | based = | language = [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]] | website = {{URL|http://www.sabado.pt/}} | issn = | oclc = }} '''''Sábado''''' is a Portuguese weekly [[news magazine]] published in Portugal. It is the first modern news magazine in the country.<ref name=dora>{{cite journal|author1=Marisa Torres da Silva|author2=Dora Santos Silva|title=Trends and transformations within cultural journalism: a case study of newsmagazine Visão|journal=Observatorio Journal|date=2014|volume=8|issue=4|pages=171-185|url=http://obs.obercom.pt/index.php/obs/article/view/811/691|accessdate=18 December 2014}}</ref>
==History and profile== ''Sábado'' was established in 1988 and closed down in 1993.<ref name=dora/> The magazine was relaunched by [[Cofina]] on 7 May 2004.<ref>{{cite web|title=Institutional presentation|url=http://www.cofina.pt/~/media/Files/C/Cofina/investors/presentations/2008pres/ppt2011/ppt2011.pdf|work=Cofina|accessdate=11 April 2015|date=2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Overview of the Sector|url=http://www.gmcs.pt/en/overview-of-the-sector-20140314-164712|work=GMCS|accessdate=22 March 2015|date=19 May 2014}}</ref><ref name=cof>{{cite web|title=Magazines|url=http://www.cofina.pt/business-overview/magazines.aspx?sc_lang=en|work=Cofina|accessdate=1 December 2014}}</ref> It is published on a weekly basis<ref name=cof/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://ejc.net/media_landscapes/portugal|title=Media Landscapes Portugal|author1=Fernando Correia|author2=Carla Martins|accessdate=9 November 2014|work=European Journalism Centre|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141027014511/http://ejc.net/media_landscapes/portugal|archivedate=27 October 2014|df=dmy-all}}</ref> and covers news on politics, society, culture, sports and leisure.<ref name=cof/>
The 2005 circulation of ''Sábado'' was 48,737 copies.<ref>{{cite book|author1=Fernando Correia|author2=Carla Martins|editor=Georgios Terzis|title=European Media Governance: National and Regional Dimensions|date=2007|publisher=Intellect Ltd.|location=Bristol|url=https://books.google.com/books?hl=en&lr=&id=68nbtqst-CsC&oi=fnd&pg=PA263&dq=sabado+magazine+in+portugal&ots=xGtuvQ2gwB&sig=DN7spfgwnugt8O9G-dst6ZjifYE&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=sabado%20magazine%20in%20portugal&f=false|accessdate=1 December 2014|chapter=The Portuguese Media Landscapes}}</ref> The weekly had a circulation of 65,000 copies in 2007.<ref>{{cite web|author=Anne Austin et. al.|title=Western Europe Market and Media Fact|url=http://conan.lib.muohio.edu/ebooks/Western_Europe_Market_MediaFact_2008/Western%20Europe%20Market%20&%20MediaFact%202008.pdf|work=Zenith Optimedia|accessdate=11 April 2015|date=2008}}</ref> Its circulation was 76,924 copies in 2010 and 74,431 copies in 2011.<ref name=ifa>{{cite web|title=Top 50 Magazines|url=http://ifabc.org/site/assets/media/Top-50-magazines-30042014.xlsx|work=IFABC|accessdate=22 March 2015|date=30 April 2014}}</ref> It was 66,456 copies in 2012.<ref name=ifa/> The magazine had a circulation of 57,261 copies between September and October 2013.<ref>{{cite web|title=Portuguese Media|url=https://www.bpiequity.bpi.pt/others/PDF.aspx?id=49681|work=BPI Equity|accessdate=2 February 2015|date=5 March 2014}}</ref>
==See also== * [[List of magazines in Portugal]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2014}} {{Infobox music festival |music_festival_name = T in the Park Festival |image = File:T in the Park Festival 2010.jpg |location = [[Strathclyde Country Park|Strathclyde Park]], [[Hamilton, South Lanarkshire|Hamilton]], [[Scotland]] {{small|(1994–1996)}}
[[Balado, Kinross|Balado]], [[Kinross-shire]], Scotland {{small|(1998–2014)}}
[[Strathallan|Strathallan Castle]], [[Auchterarder]], Scotland {{small|(2015–2016)}} |years_active= 1994–2016
2016–present (on hiatus) |dates = Second weekend of July (3 days) |genre = {{flatlist| *[[Rock music|Rock]] *[[indie rock|indie]] *[[electronic music|electronic]] *[[pop music|pop]] }} |website = [http://www.tinthepark.com www.tinthepark.com] }} '''T in the Park festival''' was a major Scottish [[music festival]] that was held annually from 1994-2016. It is named after its main sponsor, the brewing company [[Tennents]]. The event was originally held at [[Strathclyde Park]], [[Lanarkshire]] but was held at the disused [[Balado, Kinross|Balado]] airfield, [[Kinross-shire]] from 1997 to 2014. In 2015 the festival moved to Strathallan Castle, [[Strathallan]], [[Perthshire]]. Originally a two-day event, the festival became a three-day event in 2007. Promoted by [[DF Concerts]], the event attracts up to 255,000 people, along with 70,000 campers. The 2017 event was cancelled due to problems at the 2016 event. It was officially replaced with the [[TRNSMT]] festival which takes place on the same weekend at [[Glasgow Green]]. The 2017 festival was a success and was followed in 2018 with TRNSMT again. {{cite web|title=T in the Park 'not looking likely' for 2018|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-tayside-central-40593239|publisher=BBC|accessdate=27 July 2017|date=13 July 2017}} ==History== The festival was founded in 1994 by Stuart Clumpas and Geoff Ellis,{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/scotland/830160.stm |title=Clumpas has success down to a T |publisher=BBC |date=12 July 2000 |accessdate=2 October 2015}} as part of a joint venture between [[DF Concerts]] and [[Tennent's Lager]] with some help from Irish promotions company [[MCD Productions]]. Stuart Clumpas left as an organiser in 2001, selling his commercial interests in the concert.{{cite news |url=http://www.heraldscotland.com/news/12230344.Why_I_apos_m_getting_out_of_here/ |title=Why I'm getting out of here |newspaper=The Hearld |location=Scotland |date=8 September 2001 |accessdate=2 October 2015}}{{cite report |url=http://www.gla.ac.uk/media/media_168676_en.pdf |title=Promoting Business – DF Concerts |author=Martin Cloonan, Simon Frith |publisher=University of Glasgow |year=2010 |accessdate=2 October 2015}} Current festival director Geoff Ellis was involved from the start. Ellis came to Scotland in 1992 to manage [[King Tut's Wah Wah Hut]] in Glasgow. He organised the first T in the Park festival in 1994 with a smattering of bands playing to 17,000 people at its original site at [[Strathclyde Park]], [[Lanarkshire]].{{cite web|url=http://www.eveningtimes.co.uk/entertainment/music/geoff-ellis-the-man-who-created-t-in-the-park-130169n.21568491|title=Geoff Ellis, the man who created T in the Park|work=[[Evening Times]] |last=Ellis|first=Maureen|date=11 July 2013|accessdate=9 August 2013}} The festival was held there for three years until 1997, where it was held at the disused [[Balado, Kinross|Balado]] airfield, [[Kinross-shire]]. After moving to Balado the festival grew larger and by 2003, the festival was attracting up to 255,000 people; 110,000 over the weekend.{{cite web|url=http://www.thefreelibrary.com/T+IN+THE+PARK+v+GLASTONBURY%3B+T+IN+THE+PARK.-a0105041000|title=T IN THE PARK v GLASTONBURY; T IN THE PARK|publisher=[[TheFreeLibrary.com]]|website=Daily Record|date=10 July 2003|accessdate=13 August 2013}} The festival was originally a two-day event until 2007, when the Friday became a mainstay event for live music. However, the 2007 festival was criticised by many festival-goers who missed acts on the Friday due to huge traffic jams of 10 miles on the [[A91 road|A91]] and [[A977 road (Great Britain)|A977]] leading to Kinross.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/scotland/6275754.stm|title=Traffic chaos hits T in the Park|publisher=BBC|date=6 July 2007|accessdate=13 August 2013}} To prevent a repeat of the traffic chaos, in 2008 organisers allowed a limited number of campers to pitch up on the Thursday in order to cut the number of cars on the roads on the Friday.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/scotland/tayside_and_central/7243751.stm|title=Earlier camping for T in the Park|publisher=BBC|date=14 February 2008|accessdate=13 August 2013}} By extending the festival over a full three days, it began to grow rapidly, becoming the second-largest greenfield festival in the United Kingdom, and the fifth-largest in the world in terms of attendance, with over 85,000 people on site everyday.{{cite web|url=https://www.cnbc.com/id/42150834/page/6|title=The Worlds's Biggest Music Festivals|publisher=[[CNBC]]|accessdate=13 August 2013}} As of 2013, it attracted up to 255,000 people over three days, drawing fans from across Britain and Europe. According to DF Concerts, 20% of the crowd is made up of visitors from outside Scotland, with about 2% attending from overseas. In recent years, the festival has shared much of its line-up with [[Oxegen]], a festival that takes place on the same weekend in [[County Kildare]], [[Ireland]]. Acts usually play T in the Park one day and Oxegen the next, or vice versa. In an attempt to boost ticket sales, the 2014 festival saw an extension of the acts' duration on stage. On the Friday, the acts were scheduled to start around lunchtime as opposed to 5 pm; and the Saturday headliners to finish at 1 am.{{cite web|url=http://www.scotsman.com/what-s-on/music/t-in-the-park-2014-lineup-revealed-1-3319719|title=T in the Park 2014 lineup revealed|work=The Scotsman|last=Ferguson|first=Brian|date=26 February 2014|accessdate=22 March 2014}} ===Move from Balado to Strathallan=== The 2014 festival was the last to take place at the Balado site. Despite having run on the same site since 1997, safety concerns were expressed about the [[Forties pipeline system|Forties Pipeline]], which runs directly underneath the former Balado airfield.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-tayside-central-26181095|title=Pipeline concern for T in the park|publisher=BBC|date=13 February 2014|accessdate=14 February 2014}} In 2015 the festival moved 20.54 miles to the [[Strathallan]] Castle Estate in the neighbouring county of Perthshire.{{cite web|url=http://www.thecourier.co.uk/news/showbiz/t-in-the-park-unveils-castle-move-1.440782|title=Error messages – The Courier – At the heart of Tayside and Fife|work=thecourier.co.uk}} The 2016 event was marred by the deaths of three festival-goers and reports of anti-social behaviour problems at the campsite. This led festival bosses to cancel the 2017 event, making the festival's future uncertain.{{cite web|url=http://www.scotsman.com/lifestyle/culture/music/t-in-the-park-s-demise-would-be-a-victory-for-the-neds-1-4304583|title=T in the Park’s demise ‘would be a victory for the neds’|publisher=''The Scotsman''|last=Ferguson|first=Brian|date=30 November 2016|access-date=24 April 2017}} ===Brewing=== Tennents Lager is brewed just 36 hours before T in the Park at the [[Wellpark Brewery]] in [[Glasgow]], 44 miles from Balado. Nearly all the lager is brewed specifically for the weekend. More than 3 million pints of lager have been consumed at the festival since 1994.{{cite web|url=http://www.heraldscotland.com/arts-ents/music/t-in-the-park-facts-and-figures.2013072948|title=T in the Park: facts and figures|publisher=''[[The Herald (Scotland)|The Herald]]''|date=11 July 2013|accessdate=13 August 2013}} An innovative bar-cup recycling scheme was introduced in 2006 paying a 10p deposit on every empty pint container brought back to a designated recycling point. ==1994 festival== The first T in the Park was held on Saturday 30 July – Sunday 31 July 1994 at [[Strathclyde Country park]]. The site had a capacity for 17,000 people on each of the two days, with just 2000 choosing to camp.{{cite web|url=http://www.scotsman.com/what-s-on/music/love-loathing-and-t-in-the-park-1-907854|title=Love, loathing and T in the Park|publisher=''[[The Scotsman]]''|first=Doug |last=Johnstone|first2=Andrew |last2=Eaton|date=5 July 2007|accessdate=14 August 2013}} The Caledonia Stage, was introduced to showcase up and coming new bands. A band called Glass Onion played over the weekend who would later be better known as [[Travis (band)|Travis]]. ===Main stage=== {| class="wikitable" |- |Saturday 30 July || Sunday 31 July |- valign="top" | * [[Rage Against the Machine]] * [[Björk]] * [[Levellers (band)|Levellers]] * [[Cypress Hill]] * [[Crash Test Dummies]] * [[Chumbawamba]] * [[Yothu Yindi]] * [[Consolidated (band)|Consolidated]] * [[Honky (band)|Honky]] * [[Paul Oakenfold]] || * [[Primal Scream]] * [[Del Amitri]] * [[Teenage Fanclub]] * [[Crowded House]] * [[The Saw Doctors]] * [[Gun (band)|Gun]] * [[Grant Lee Buffalo]] * [[Aimee Mann]] * [[Baby Chaos]] |} ===King Tut's Tent=== {| class="wikitable" |- |Saturday 30 July || Sunday 31 July |- valign="top" | * [[Blur (band)|Blur]] * [[Manic Street Preachers]] * [[Pulp (band)|Pulp]] * [[James Taylor Quartet]] * [[S*M*A*S*H]] * [[Headswim]] * [[The Grid]] * [[Kerbdog]] * [[AC Acoustics]] || * [[D Ream|D:Ream]] * [[House of Pain]] * [[One Dove]] * [[Whiteout (band)|Whiteout]] * [[Oasis (band)|Oasis]] * [[Mike Peters (musician)|Mike Peters]] * [[Thrum (band)|Thrum]] * [[Tiny Monroe]] |} ==1995 festival== Was held on Saturday 5 August – Sunday 6 August 1995 at [[Strathclyde Country park]]. This was the first year there was a sell out on one of the days. Noel Gallagher joined Paul Weller on stage, while Kermit from the Black Grapes' had broken his ankle earlier in the day but refused to go to hospital instead performed with the rest of the band whilst sitting down on the stage. The Dance Tent was introduced this year, but no official line was used, it became the Slam Tent in 1997. ===Main stage=== {| class="wikitable" |- |Saturday 5 August || Sunday 6 August |- valign="top" | * [[Paul Weller]] * [[Therapy?]] * [[Terrorvision]] * [[The Prodigy]] * [[Black Grape]] * [[Gene (band)|Gene]] * [[Dodgy]] * [[The Wildhearts]] * [[Skunk Anansie]] || * [[M People]] * [[The Beautiful South]] * [[Kylie Minogue]] * [[Tricky (musician)|Tricky]] * [[The Charlatans (English band)|The Charlatans]] * [[Shed Seven]] * [[Marion (band)|Marion]] * [[The Radoos]] |} ===King Tut's Tent=== {| class="wikitable" |- |Saturday 5 August || Sunday 6 August |- valign="top" | * [[Elastica]] * [[Supergrass]] * [[Echobelly]] * [[Menswear (band)|Menswear]] * [[The Bluetones]] * [[Ash (band)|Ash]] * [[Powder (band)|Powder]] * [[Corduroy (band)|Corduroy]] * [[Cast (band)|Cast]] || * [[Salad (band)|Salad]] * [[The Verve]] * [[dEUS (band)|dEUS]] * [[The Shamen]] * [[Underworld (band)|Underworld]] * [[Dreadzone]] * [[Fluke (band)|Fluke]] * [[Republica]] |} ==1996 festival== Was held on Saturday 13 July – Sunday 14 July 1996, and was the last time at [[Strathclyde Country park]]. The Saturday was a sell out for the first time in advance. Radiohead closed the Main Stage on Saturday night and Pulp closing on the Sunday. This was also the year that Keanu Reeves arrived on a shuttle bus to play the festival with his band Dogstar, and Joe Strummer busked in the campsite Caledonia Stage was renamed the '''T Break''', where unsigned acts from across Scotland are given a platform to showcase their music at T in the Park. Each year, a panel made up of music industry experts hand-picked 16 artists from over a thousand entries to platform.{{cite web|url=http://www.tennents.com/tbreak/about-t-break/ |title=About T Break – Tennent's T Break |publisher=Tennents.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-20}} ===Main stage=== {| class="wikitable" |- |Saturday 13 July || Sunday 14 July |- valign="top" | * [[Radiohead]] * [[Alanis Morissette]] * [[The Prodigy|Prodigy]] * [[Foo Fighters]] * [[Space]] * [[The Jesus Lizard]] * [[Honeycrack]] * [[The Supernaturals]] * [[Cecil (band)|Cecil]] || * [[Pulp (band)|Pulp]] * [[Black
